arguments.description: Python file to run and measure.
arguments.name: pyfile

arguments.description: Optional arguments passed to the pyfile.
arguments.name: program options

description: Run a Python program, measuring code execution.

options.description: Append coverage data to .coverage, otherwise it starts clean each time.
options.name: --append

options.description: Measure branch coverage in addition to statement coverage.
options.name: --branch

options.description: Properly measure code using a concurrency library. Valid values are: eventlet, gevent, greenlet, multiprocessing, thread, or a comma-list of them.
options.name: --concurrency

options.description: The context label to record for this coverage run.
options.name: --context

options.description: Write the recorded coverage data to this file. Defaults to '.coverage'. [env: COVERAGE_FILE]
options.name: --data-file

options.description: Include only files whose paths match one of these patterns. Accepts shell-style wildcards, which must be quoted.
options.name: --include

options.description: <pyfile> is an importable Python module, not a script path, to be run as 'python -m' would run it.
options.name: --module

options.description: Omit files whose paths match one of these patterns. Accepts shell-style wildcards, which must be quoted.
options.name: --omit

options.description: Measure coverage even inside the Python installed library, which isn't done by default.
options.name: --pylib

options.description: Append the machine name, process id and random number to the data file name to simplify collecting data from many processes.
options.name: --parallel-mode

options.description: A list of directories or importable names of code to measure.
options.name: --source

options.description: Use the slower Python trace function core.
options.name: --timid

options.description: Debug options, separated by commas. [env: COVERAGE_DEBUG]
options.name: --debug

options.description: Specify configuration file. By default '.coveragerc', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini', and 'pyproject.toml' are tried. [env: COVERAGE_RCFILE]
options.name: --rcfile
